channel.title: CVE Feed for AMD -- 2nd Gen AMD EPYC™
channel.description: The latest CVEs for AMD -- 2nd Gen AMD EPYC™

item.title: CVE-2021-46769|2024-08-04T05:17:42.984Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient syscall input validation in the ASP Bootloader may allow a privileged attacker to execute arbitrary DMA copies, which can lead to code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-46764|2024-08-04T05:17:42.271Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Improper validation of DRAM addresses in SMU may allow an attacker to overwrite sensitive memory locations within the ASP potentially resulting in a denial of service.

item.title: CVE-2021-46763|2024-08-04T05:17:42.477Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the SMU may enable a privileged attacker to write beyond the intended bounds of a shared memory buffer potentially leading to a loss of integrity.

item.title: CVE-2021-46775|2024-08-04T05:17:42.634Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Improper input validation in ABL may enable an attacker with physical access, to perform arbitrary memory overwrites, potentially leading to a loss of integrity and code execution.

item.title: CVE-2021-46762|2024-08-04T05:17:42.237Z -- amd -- 2nd%20gen%20amd%20epyc%E2%84%A2
item.description: Insufficient input validation in the SMU may allow an attacker to corrupt SMU SRAM potentially leading to a loss of integrity or denial of service.
